required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hand & Wrist Pyrocarbon Implants Outcomes Clinical Study
clinical_study.official_title: Hand & Wrist Pyrocarbon Implants Outcomes Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: HaWPYC is an international Post-Market Clinical Follow-up (PMCF) to collect post-market safety and performance data on commercially available Wright Medical Pyrocarbon (PyC) hand and wrist implants. Data may be used for Post-Market Surveillance, and regulatory requirements.

primary_outcome.description: Number of device associated and procedure associated adverse events
Rates of revision surgeries; assessed using the Kaplan-Meyer analysis

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical assessment: change from baseline in QuickDash score
primary_outcome.description: QuickDash = Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand), self-report questionnaire; 11 items to measure physical function and symptoms; items scored on a 1-5-point scale which is then transformed resulting in a score from 0 (least disability) to 100 (most disability).

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical assessment: change from baseline in PRWE score
primary_outcome.description: PRWE = Patient-rated Wrist Evaluation; patient reported outcome developed to assess pain in the wrist joint and functional difficulties in activities of daily living resulting from injuries affecting wrist joint area. 15-item questionnaire made of two subscales (pain and function), resulting in a score from 0 to 100; Less score = better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical assessment: change from baseline in Strength score
primary_outcome.description: Grip/grasp, tip and key pinch strength will be evaluated using a dynamometer.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical assessment: change from baseline in Mobility score
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of mobility (movement amplitude and functionality) will be assessed through angle measurement, using a goniometer. Measured movements will be flexion/extension, radial deviation/ulnar deviation, pronation/supination, adduction/abduction, opposition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient Satisfaction scores
secondary_outcome.description: Single, subjective question measuring patient satisfaction; assessed through 4 levels satisfaction: "Very Satisfied, Satisfied, Dissatisfied, and Very Dissatisfied".

study_pop.textblock:
480 patients will be enrolled (80 per implant type). Prospective patients: screening and surgery should occur after the site initiation visit.
"Ambispective" patients:
- Screening and surgery occurred before the date of site initiation visit,
- Follow-up visits (at least the last one) must be prospective (i.e: must occur after the date of site initiation visit),
- Inclusions of consecutive patients,
- Minimum available data must be available for each completed visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older at the time he/she receives the information and signs the informed consent (when applicable as per local regulatory requirements),
- Informed on the study and willing to sign an informed consent form approved by Institutional Review Board or Ethics Committee,
- Willing and able to comply with the requirements of the study protocol,
- For prospective inclusion: considered for treatment with a Wright Medical PyC Hand/Wrist study implant (primary or revision surgery),
- For "ambispective" inclusion: must have undergone a Hand or Wrist arthroplasty with a Wright Medical PyC Hand/Wrist study implant before the date of site initiation visit,
- Follow-up visits (at least the last one) must be prospective,
- Patient must have complete information available for each completed visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient pertaining to one of the categories referred to as "vulnerable population" in the French Law (articles L. 1121-5 to L. 1121-8 of the French Public Health Code), or as "particularly vulnerable persons" in the Swiss Federal Law (Chapter 3, Sections 1 to 4 of CC 810.30 Federal Act on Research involving Human Beings - Human Research Act, HRA),
- Patient unable to comply with the study procedures based on the judgment of the investigator (e.g. cannot comprehend study questions, inability to keep scheduled assessment times),
- Any medical condition that could impact on the study outcomes functional signification at the investigator's discretion (e.g., neuropathy, allergy…)
